page.title: 17BUILDINGS CAUSEY,COPPY AREA
page.content: {CAUSEY ARCH PUBLIC HOUSE}this pub was built about 1750.It is situated on the A6076 2km.S.of Marley Hill. {CAUSEY ARCH SCHOOL-}built in 1896,by the Tanfield School Board.It is now a builder's yard and store. {BEAMISH PARK HOTEL}built in 1980. This is one of the few new buildings in the area.Situated opposite the Causey Arch Public House. {BEAMISH RED ROW}modern bungalows have now been built on the site of an old row of cottages,next to{BLACK HORSE Public House which was built about 1750. {COPPY}a small hamlet of private houses adjacent to{COPPY FARM}which now incorporates a riding centre and is situated 1km.S.E. of the Causey Arch. There are several isolated buildings eg.Mount Cottage and Parkhead.Andrews House is a derelict farmhouse.
